title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.71 - Executive Order No. 71: Designating Justice Felice K. Shea to hold an Extraordinary Special and Trial Term of the Supreme Court in and for the County of Queens, in place of Justice Ernst H. Rosenberger. [*][DAGGER]
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.71 - Executive Order No. 71: Designating Justice Felice K. Shea to hold an Extraordinary Special and Trial Term of the Supreme Court in and for the County of Queens, in place of Justice Ernst H. Rosenberger. [*][DAGGER]
State Regulations
WHEREAS, By an Order dated the thirteenth day of October, nineteen hundred seventy-two, an Extraordinary Special and Trial Term of the

Supreme Court in and for the County of Queens was appointed; and
WHEREAS, By order dated the fifth day of January, nineteen
hundred seventy-eight, the Honorable Ernst H. Rosenberger, a Justice of the

Supreme Court of the State of New York, First Judicial District, was designated
to hold said Extraordinary Special and Trial Term of the Supreme Court; and
WHEREAS, The designation of the Honorable Ernst H. Rosenberger is terminated in view of the designation of said Honorable Justice
as a Justice of the Appellate Division, First Department; NOW, THEREFORE, it appearing to my satisfaction that the
public interest requires it, and in accordance with article VI, section 27 of
the Constitution, statute and law in such case made and provided, I do hereby
designate the Honorable Felice K. Shea, a Justice of the Supreme Court of the

State of New York, First Judicial District, to hold the said Extraordinary

Special and Trial Term in and for the County of Kings, in the place and stead
of the Honorable Ernst H. Rosenberger. I do further direct that copies of the notice of
designation hereinabove made and provided for shall be released and distributed
to the general press. Signed: Mario M. Cuomo

Dated: July 25, 1985

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
4.71

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
